meanings.definition: To cause confusion or disorder in (a situation)
meanings.sent1: The new student was snafuing the classroom by rearranging all the desks.
meanings.sent2: The chef was snafuing the kitchen by misplacing the ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally snafued his own magic trick, making the rabbit disappear too soon.
meanings.sent4: The toddler snafued the puzzle pieces, mixing up the colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The storm snafued the picnic, blowing away the food and decorations.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error in (a task)
meanings.sent1: She kept snafuing the math problems, getting the answers wrong each time.
meanings.sent2: He was snafuing the painting, accidentally mixing the colors together.
meanings.sent3: The robot snafued the dance routine, tripping over its own wires.
meanings.sent4: The student snafued the science experiment, causing a small explosion.
meanings.sent5: The baker snafued the cake recipe, forgetting to add sugar.

meanings.definition: To mess up or bungle (an action)
meanings.sent1: The comedian was snafuing his jokes, forgetting the punchlines.
meanings.sent2: The actor was snafuing his lines, causing confusion on stage.
meanings.sent3: The explorer snafued the map, leading the group in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent4: The musician snafued the performance, playing the wrong notes.
meanings.sent5: The gardener snafued the planting, mixing up the flowers and vegetables.
